stories.title: CA's electric car revolution, designed to save the planet,unleashes a toll on it
A Texas Native Competes for Japan at the Tokyo Olympics

stories.text:
I’m starting a new company and I need to start gathering user feedback. I’ve created Google Forms with the questions I want to ask so I can keep track of everything.

My question is how do I find and break the ice to start talking to strangers?

The type of people I need to speak to are hiring managers and anyone who’s use/found a job using a site like Indeed.

Finding the job seekers has been easy because I could start with friends and family. Finding hiring managers has been the hard part because I don’t have any in my immediate contacts.

What strategies would you use to find these people and interview them?

Thanks HN!
stories.title: Ask HN: How to Interview Users
